      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMultiValuedParamFromQueryString(java.net.URI uri, java.lang.String paramName)

      static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseQueryString(java.net.URI uri)
      Parse the query string of a URI (typically used in archiver config strings) and return these as a name value pair hashmap.

    • Method Detail

      • parseQueryString

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseQueryString(java.net.URI uri)
                                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Parse the query string of a URI (typically used in archiver config strings) and return these as a name value pair hashmap. We do not handle multiple values for the same param in this call; we simply replace previous names.
        Parameters:
        uri -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        java.io.IOException

      • getMultiValuedParamFromQueryString

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMultiValuedParamFromQueryString(java.net.URI uri,
                                                                                  java.lang.String paramName)
                                                                           throws java.io.IOException
        If you do expect a param to have multiple values, use this method to get all the possible values for a name.
        Parameters:
        uri -
        paramName -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
